noun.description: Chiefly English regional (northern) and Scottish. A wandering beggar; a vagrant; a wanderer, a walker; a pedlar.

adjective.description: Chiefly English regional (northern) and Scottish. Vagabond, vagrant; wandering.

origin: Late Middle English; earliest use found in Richard Rolle (a1310–1349), hermit and religious author. Probably from gang + -rel.
